alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Moore (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 07 at 4:32PM CDT until July 07 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MOORE AND EASTERN LINCOLN COUNTIES... At 431 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Fayetteville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Lincoln, Mulberry, Elora, Hurdlow, Mimosa, Booneville, Marble Hill, Skinem and Smithland. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to localized flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
